thread.title: Stripper Wells Are Wild Card in Oil Rout
thread.title_full: Stripper Wells Are Wild Card in Oil Rout - WSJ

author: Nicole Friedman
title: Stripper Wells Are Wild Card in Oil Rout
text:
Steve Plants, vice president of Plants & Goodwin Inc. in Shinglehouse, Pa., still pumps crude oil from wells drilled in the 1890s.
But with the price of crude below $50 a barrel, some of those low-producing wells, known as stripper wells, donâ€™t turn a profit. Mr. Plants has permanently closed 10 wells, he says, and plans to plug another 10...
